member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Foundation.PCWSTR
member.summary: A PCWSTR is a pointer to a constant, null-terminated Unicode string — that is, a wide-character string used by the Windows API.
member.remarks:
The PCWSTR type represents a read-only string of UTF-16 (wchar_t) characters, terminated by a null wide character (L'\0'). It is primarily used when a Windows API function receives string input but does not modify it.
This type is declared in WinNT.h as follows: typedef CONST WCHAR *PCWSTR;
Related string pointer types include:
— mutable wide string pointer
— constant narrow (ANSI) string pointer
— mutable narrow (ANSI) string pointer
